meanings.definition: Resembling a block in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The toy robot had a blockish head.
meanings.sent2: The building had a blockish design with sharp edges.
meanings.sent3: The blockish cloud looked like a giant cube in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her blockish haircut made her face seem more angular.
meanings.sent5: The blockish rock stood out among the smooth pebbles on the beach.

meanings.sent1: The turtle moved in a blockish manner across the sand.
meanings.sent2: His blockish responses indicated a lack of understanding.
meanings.sent3: The blockish sloth took its time climbing the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her blockish movements in the game revealed her inexperience.
meanings.sent5: The blockish student struggled to grasp the concept.
